module.name: class_of_product
module.keywords: application, module, class, product, physical object, part type, material type, process plant

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record the existence of a class of product.
Membership of a class of product may indicate the nature of an individual product.
A class of physical object can be more or less generic. A class of physical object can involve different types of criteria, as illustrated below

dd.example: 'Multi-stage centrifugal pump' is a class of product.

dd.p: the possible use of a product;
dd.example: 'Fire water pump' is a class of product.
'Fire water pump in complex A' is a class of product.

dd.p: the nature and structure of the product at scales smaller than those of normal engineering concern.
dd.example: 'SG cast iron' is a class of product.

dd.p: the grouping of individual products for administrative purposes;
dd.example: '1999 production run of pump type XYZ_123' is a class of product.
'Pumps maintained by J. Bloggs and Co. under contract PM_1234' is a class of product.

dd.p: the specification of a product, for a particular engineering activity.
dd.example: 'J. Bloggs pump type XYZ_123' is a class of product. This class, defined by J. Bloggs and Co., may be specified in a purchase order.

li.p: the existence of a class of product.

li.note: An individual product is within the scope of the Product_as_individual application module.

li.p: membership of a class of product;
li.note: Membership of a class of product is within the scope of the Product_structure_and_classification application module.
Relationships between classes of product are within the scopes of the Class_of_composition_of_product, Class_of_connection_of_product, and Class_of_containment_of_product application modules.

li.p: involvement of a class of product in a class of activity.
li.note: Involvement of a class of product in a class of activity is within the scope of the Class_of_involvement_in_activity and Class_of_connection_of_product application module.

uof.name: Class_of_product
uof.description: The Class_of_product UoF identifies a class of product.
